bug.author: marcespie
bug.summary: -lrt is not needed on OpenBSD either
bug.description: Seems to me someone should really write a test for the location of clock_gettime(). Or maybe just reverse the test. Because NetBSD and FreeBSD have clock_gettime as part of libc either. They won't error out because they have a stub -lrt. AFAIK, only Linux requires -lrt to get clock_gettime...

comments.comment: Thanks for the input! Where are you seeing that -lrt is being used? As far as I know we're not explicitly linking against it. Also the timers use stuff from chrono, not clock_gettime() (unless chrono internally uses clock_gettime(), but that shouldn't make a huge difference in our case anyway). Are you by chance using a really old version of mlpack (like mlpack 1.x or 2.x)? I seem to remember those explicitly linking against -lrt in places.
